_source_item.title: NetNewsWire Turns 23
_source_item.content:
NetNewsWire 1.0 for Mac shipped 23 years ago today! ğŸ¸ğŸ©ğŸ•¶ï¸
Hereâ€™s where things are on this particular February 11: we just shipped 7.0 for Mac and iOS, and now weâ€™re working on NetNewsWire 7.0.1.
After a big release, no matter how careful we are, there are often some regressions to fix and tweaks to make right away, so weâ€™re working on those. Hereâ€™s the milestone with the
current to-do list
.
Big picture: we still have a lot of bugs to fix, lots of tech debt to deal with, and lots of polish-needed areas of the app. With
Brentâ€™s retirement last year
weâ€™ve been able to go
way
faster on dealing with all this. We plan to keep up the pace.
Here are our current plans:
For
NetNewsWire 7.1
weâ€™re focusing on syncing fixes and improvements.
NetNewsWire 7.2
doesnâ€™t have a focus yet. Could end up being UX fixes and polish, could be something else. Could be a potpourri, though we do prefer having a focus when possible.
We donâ€™t have a NetNewsWire 7.3 plan yet â€”Â thatâ€™s too far out. Depends on what actually happens with 7.1 and 7.2, and it depends on what Apple adds to our to-do list at WWDC this year. (Touchscreen Macs? Folding iPhones? Big new Swift features? Who knows!)
Note that we do add and remove tickets from milestones at any time â€”Â none of this is set in stone, of course.
Itâ€™s NetNewsWireâ€™s birthday, but thatâ€™s a day to look forward, not to look back. The very best versions of NetNewsWire are still to come!
